text: Notes that the current funding model is expected to result in 215 million dollars from the levy, cost-sharing and the projected voluntary contribution in 2025, decides to authorize the Secretary-General, exceptionally and without creating a precedent, to enter into commitments with assessment not exceeding 53 million dollars for the period from 1 January to 31 December 2025, in accordance with United Nations financial regulations and rules, to support the funding of the resident coordinator system, and requests the Secretary-General to report on the use of the commitment authority and its continuation in the context of his performance and budget reports;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Commitment authority up to 53 million dollars for 2025
Report on use and continuation of commitment authority in performance and budget reports

textWithHighlights: *Notes* that the current funding model is expected to result in 215 million dollars from the levy, cost-sharing and the projected voluntary contribution in 2025, *decides* to authorize the <<Secretary-General>>, exceptionally and without creating a precedent, to enter into [[commitments]] with assessment not exceeding 53 million dollars for the period from 1 January to 31 December 2025, in accordance with United Nations financial regulations and rules, to support the funding of the {{resident coordinator system}}, and *requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to [[report]] on the use of the commitment authority and its continuation in the context of his performance and budget reports;
uncertainties: We treat “decides to authorize” as the operative deciding verb (rather than separately annotating “authorize”). The Resident Coordinator System is annotated as a mentioned entity (RCS) rather than an assignee since it is the funding beneficiary. The deliverable under the deciding clause is captured as commitment authority/commitments; categorization as financial_resources seems most appropriate.

text: Requests the Secretary-General to submit a refined comprehensive and detailed report on the financing of and governance over the resident coordinator system to the General Assembly at its eighty-first session, including the following elements:

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Report on financing and governance of resident coordinator system

textWithHighlights: *Requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to submit a refined comprehensive and detailed [[report]] on the financing of and governance over the {{resident coordinator system}} to the {{General Assembly}} at its eighty-first session, including the following elements:

text: The presentation of the proposed structure and resource requirements for the resident coordinator system, in terms of both post and non-post costs, taking into account, inter alia, patterns of expenditure, the workload needs of each office in the field and at Headquarters, based on an office-by-office review of the “one-size-fits-all” approach to the structure of resident coordinator offices and resource requirements for the system that are tailored to the context and needs of the host country, in the context of United Nations Sustainable Development Cooperation Frameworks, and the respective size of United Nations country teams, and the sharing of staff and resources with relevant United Nations entities;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Presentation of proposed structure and resource requirements for the resident coordinator system
deliverables.deliverable: presentation of the proposed structure and resource requirements

textWithHighlights: The [[presentation of the proposed structure and resource requirements]] for the resident coordinator system, in terms of both post and non-post costs, taking into account, inter alia, patterns of expenditure, the workload needs of each office in the field and at Headquarters, based on an office-by-office review of the “one-size-fits-all” approach to the structure of resident coordinator offices and resource requirements for the system that are tailored to the context and needs of the host country, in the context of United Nations Sustainable Development Cooperation Frameworks, and the respective size of {{United Nations country teams}}, and the sharing of staff and resources with relevant {{United Nations entities}};
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the directive "requests" from the parent clause. The deliverable type could also be interpreted as part of a 'report'; here it is classified as 'analysis' as it specifies analytical content to be presented.

text: A comprehensive review of all possible funding models and funding streams, including a review of the adjustment of the coordination levy and cost-sharing arrangements, that takes into account past inflation over the years and reflects the diverse roles, capacities and mandates of entities of the United Nations Sustainable Development Group, voluntary contributions, assessed contributions, income generated by interest rates in different United Nations accounts with options to mitigate any potential negative impacts on programme countries, and redeployment of efficiency gains, and bearing in mind the need for a durable and sustainable financing solution, and that the sources of funding for future potential requests for changes in resource requirements of the resident coordinator system will not be strictly limited to any one funding stream of the hybrid funding model, which includes the partial redeployment of efficiency gains through cost-sharing;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Comprehensive review of funding models and streams for the resident coordinator system
Options to mitigate negative impacts on programme countries
deliverables.deliverable: options to mitigate any potential negative impacts

textWithHighlights: A [[comprehensive review]] of all possible funding models and funding streams, including a review of the adjustment of the coordination levy and cost-sharing arrangements, that takes into account past inflation over the years and reflects the diverse roles, capacities and mandates of entities of the {{United Nations Sustainable Development Group}}, voluntary contributions, assessed contributions, income generated by interest rates in different United Nations accounts with [[options to mitigate any potential negative impacts]] on programme countries, and redeployment of efficiency gains, and bearing in mind the need for a durable and sustainable financing solution, and that the sources of funding for future potential requests for changes in resource requirements of the resident coordinator system will not be strictly limited to any one funding stream of the hybrid funding model, which includes the partial redeployment of efficiency gains through cost-sharing;
uncertainties: Verb and assignee are inherited from the parent clause that requests the Secretary-General to submit a report including specific elements. Classified “comprehensive review” as a review deliverable and “options to mitigate negative impacts” as recommendations. Normalized “United Nations Sustainable Development Group” to “UN Development System” as per available entity list.

text: A detailed results-based accountability model and performance framework strengthening the role of oversight and accountability mechanisms of resident coordinator offices and the overall resident coordinator system at the national, regional and global levels;
